title: Klavs Rasmussen
text:
Klavs Rasmussen (born 23 June 1966) is a <a href="Denmark">Danish</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a> most recently in charge of Ghanaian football club <a href="West%20African%20Football%20Academy">West African Football Academy</a>.
Rasmussen had worked as a youth coach at <a href="Kj%C3%B8benhavns%20Boldklub">KB</a> for 20 years, when he became assistant manager at <a href="Odense%20Boldklub">Odense Boldklub</a> in January 2002. In January 2004, he became joint manager of the club together with <a href="Troels%20Bech">Troels Bech</a>. They were both sacked in June 2005.
He later managed <a href="BK%20Avarta">BK Avarta</a>, <a href="%C3%98lstykke%20FC">Ølstykke FC</a>, the women’s team of <a href="Br%C3%B8ndby%20IF">Brøndby IF</a>, and <a href="N%C3%A6stved%20Boldklub">Næstved Boldklub</a>.
On 28 June 2012, he was named new manager of <a href="Hobro%20IK">Hobro IK</a>. He resigned on 17 January 2013.
In November 2016, he was announced as the new head coach of the Ghanaian football club <a href="West%20African%20Football%20Academy">West African Football Academy</a>. He resigned on 20 April 2018, following a string of four defeats.
